Inclusivity                       FYRE Assignment Process                       Project Pay Attention                                                                   The On Campus Experience                             Living on campus should feel like your “home away from home.” There are many ways to connect with people, places, and parts of the city and The Office of Residential Life & Housing Services is here to help this happen. Joining a community takes transition and finding your “fit.” NYU’s diverse population, intellectual and personal growth opportunities, and the fact that we’re located in the heart of New York City offer many options for everyone to find a niche for themselves.   The best way to feel like you are a part of the community is to get involved. Join an organization, participate in a leadership workshop, or create your own organization and programming! Utilize your Resident Assistant (RA) and hall staff to help you find out what is there for you and what your interests are.   This website showcases many of the opportunities we create to enrich the NYU community. If you see something you like contact those involved or check in with your Residence Hall Director to get connected!   We’re happy to have you!                                        Special Interest Housing Are you interested in Special Interest Housing such as Explorations, The Residential College, International House, Green House, or Senior House? Find out how easy it is to get involved! Read More                                NYU On Campus Experience Blog   Follow us on tumblr to get a peek of all of the amazing programs our residential staff and faculty put on to make living on campus a meaningful experience.
